page.title: 03WADENHOE CHURCH 2
page.content: The chancel was recased early in the eighteenth century and the tower restored at the same time. In 1901 there was extensive restoration of the fabric when the floors of the nave and aisles were lowered to their original level and the tower underpinned to a solid foundation. The roof beams are all modern. The church is also interesting because it has some plaques in memory of some well-known admirals. Another interesting feature of the church is that it is on a hill outside the village overlooking the Nene. From the churchyard, kept down by sheep<!> you can also see the churches at Achurch,Clopton and Achurch. The villagers want to improve the parish-hall and recently held a big fund-raising event.
